required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality Of Life Assessment In Alzheimer's Disease (AD) Patients Receiving Aricept Tablets
clinical_study.official_title: Quality Of Life Assessment In AD Patients Receiving Aricept Tablets (Donepezil Hydrochloride)

brief_summary.textblock: This study assessed the Hr QoL (Health related Quality of life) of subjects with mild to moderate AD, who received ARICEPT under usual clinical practice.

detailed_description.textblock: This non-interventional study enrolled patients with mild to moderate dementia of the Alzheimer's type, who have been prescribed treatment with ARICEPT under usual clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants for Change From Baseline for Clinical Global Impressions of Improvement (CGI-I) at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: CGI-I is a 7-point physician rated scale ranging from very much improved to very much worse.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants for Change From Baseline for the Caregiver's Assessment of Improvement at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: The caregiver's assessment improvement was a 5-point rated scale ranging from much improved to much worse to the question 'compared to the severity of your relative's condition at baseline, how much do you feel it has changed?'.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Participant's Assessment for Quality of Life for Alzheimer's Dementia (QoL-AD) Overall and Subscale Scores at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: QoL-AD was comprised of 13 individual items, each measured on a 4-point Likert scale (ranging from 1 [poor] to 4 [excellent]). Overall QoL-AD score was the sum of the scores for the 13 individual items and ranged from 13 to 52, with higher scores indicating a higher health related quality of life.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Caregiver's Assessment for Quality of Life for Alzheimer's Dementia (QoL-AD) Overall and Subscale Scores at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: QoL-AD was comprised of 13 individual items, each measured on a 4-point Likert scale (ranging from 1 [poor] to 4 [excellent]). Overall QoL-AD score was the sum of the scores for the 13 individual items and ranged from 13 to 52, with higher scores indicating a higher health related quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in ARICEPT Dosing: Number of Participants for Time to First ARICEPT Dose Escalation
secondary_outcome.description: The starting dose of ARICPET was 5 mg once daily (QD), which could be increased to 10 mg QD during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in ARICEPT Dosing: Number of Participants at Each Final Dose of ARICEPT
Number of Participants for the Physician's Assessment of Tolerance to ARICEPT at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The physician rated tolerance to ARICEPT as very good, good, adequate, unsatisfactory, or unevaluable.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with mild to moderate dementia of the Alzheimer's type

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Alzheimer's Disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- There are no exclusion criteria

facility.name: General Hospital of Athens Laikon Dementia Department
General State Hospital "G. Genimatas", Neurology Department
Psychiatric Hospital of Attica Dromokaiteio, Psychiatric Department
HYGEIA Diagnostic & Therapeutic Center of Athens Internal Medicine Department
Center of Psychiatric Health of Katerini
A.H.E.P.A University General Hospital of Thessaloniki
B´ IKA Panagia Hospital, Dementia Departments
Psychiatric Hospital of Thessaloniki, Psychiatric Department

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: ARICEPT
group.description: ARICEPT (donepezil hydrochloride) 5 milligram (mg) or 10 mg once daily (QD) orally. 5 mg QD was maintained for at least 4 weeks. The recommended maximum dose was 10 mg QD.

participants_list.participants: 1 subject died during the study; 1 subject died following permanent discontinuation from the study.

group.title: ARICEPT
group.description: ARICEPT (donepezil hydrochloride) 5 milligram (mg) or 10 mg once daily (QD) orally. 5 mg QD was maintained for at least 4 weeks. The recommended maximum dose was 10 mg QD.

measure.title: Medical History
measure.description: Participants were counted once per medical history but could be counted in more than one medical history.

class.title: Personality change due to a general medical condit
Psychotic disorder due to a general medical condit

outcome.title: Number of Participants for Change From Baseline for Clinical Global Impressions of Improvement (CGI-I) at Week 12
outcome.description: CGI-I is a 7-point physician rated scale ranging from very much improved to very much worse.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose (including partial doses) of ARICEPT.

group.title: ARICEPT
group.description: ARICEPT (donepezil hydrochloride) 5 milligram (mg) or 10 mg once daily (QD) orally. 5 mg QD was maintained for at least 4 weeks. The recommended maximum dose was 10 mg QD.

measure.title: Number of Participants for Change From Baseline for Clinical Global Impressions of Improvement (CGI-I) at Week 12
measure.description: CGI-I is a 7-point physician rated scale ranging from very much improved to very much worse.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose (including partial doses) of ARICEPT.

analysis.groups_desc: The effect of possible prognostic factors response on response rate: primary diagnosis severity. Participants were classified as responders if they were very much improved or much improved from baseline.

outcome.title: Number of Participants for Change From Baseline for the Caregiver's Assessment of Improvement at Week 12
outcome.description: The caregiver's assessment improvement was a 5-point rated scale ranging from much improved to much worse to the question ‘compared to the severity of your relative’s condition at baseline, how much do you feel it has changed?’.

group.title: ARICEPT
group.description: ARICEPT (donepezil hydrochloride) 5 milligram (mg) or 10 mg once daily (QD) orally. 5 mg QD was maintained for at least 4 weeks. The recommended maximum dose was 10 mg QD.

measure.title: Number of Participants for Change From Baseline for the Caregiver's Assessment of Improvement at Week 12
measure.description: The caregiver's assessment improvement was a 5-point rated scale ranging from much improved to much worse to the question ‘compared to the severity of your relative’s condition at baseline, how much do you feel it has changed?’.

analysis.groups_desc: The effect of possible prognostic factors on response: significant medical history. Participants were classified as responders if they were much improved or improved from baseline.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Participant's Assessment for Quality of Life for Alzheimer's Dementia (QoL-AD) Overall and Subscale Scores at Week 12
outcome.description: QoL-AD was comprised of 13 individual items, each measured on a 4-point Likert scale (ranging from 1 [poor] to 4 [excellent]). Overall QoL-AD score was the sum of the scores for the 13 individual items and ranged from 13 to 52, with higher scores indicating a higher health related quality of life.
outcome.population: FAS; (n)=number of participants evaluable at baseline and Week 12.

group.title: ARICEPT
group.description: ARICEPT (donepezil hydrochloride) 5 milligram (mg) or 10 mg once daily (QD) orally. 5 mg QD was maintained for at least 4 weeks. The recommended maximum dose was 10 mg QD.

Overall QoL-AD score was the sum of the scores for the 13 individual items and ranged from 13 to 52, with higher scores indicating a higher health related quality of life.
measure.population: FAS; (n)=number of participants evaluable at baseline and Week 12.

outcome.description: The starting dose of ARICPET was 5 mg once daily (QD), which could be increased to 10 mg QD during the study.
outcome.population: FAS. Starting dose of ARICEPT was not summarized.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: ARICEPT
group.description: ARICEPT (donepezil hydrochloride) 5 milligram (mg) or 10 mg once daily (QD) orally. 5 mg QD was maintained for at least 4 weeks. The recommended maximum dose was 10 mg QD.

event.sub_title: Behavioural and psychiatric symptoms of dementia

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
